summary:
Opinion on me from one of my Former Manager: 

"Sudipta used to be part of my team. As his direct manager I recommend him because of his skills and attitude: always aiming to exceed his goals.
At Alfa Laval I experienced Sudipta as a pro-active project manager. Full of energy and aiming for the best for all stakeholders. Full focus on project milestones, quality and budget.
Sudipta will add value in an international environment within larger, complex organizations. He has clear and professional communication skills.
Beside the professional attitude Sudipta is a good team player too and above all he is a nice colleague.”

Who I am: 

A highly motivated and committed Industrial Engineer with a proven ability to effectively evaluate, organize and prioritize work within an overall project schedule.

I polished my Master's degree in Quality and Operations Management program at the Chalmers University of Technology. After pursuing my Master's degree, I started working at Alfa Laval, Nijmegen, and later at Foot Locker EMEA as a Senior Coordinator. Currently, I am working as an EMDC Manufacturing Coordinator at Glory.  

My Master thesis was done at "SKF Group" on the topic titled "Supply Chain Transparency for SKF Group Purchasing" where I believe I showed my potential based on my theoretical knowledge, training and previous experience.

One of the things that I enjoy most about engineering is the ever-evolving role of a problem solver. I am all about making the “what if's” become the “why not's”. For enriching my professional development, I have accomplished & added in my bucket list "SIX SIGMA Black Belt PROJECT" which was done in ESSITY (former SCA). Besides, I was awarded Google Developers Challenge Scholarship opportunity for the Front-End Web Developer track. Additionally, I have gathered experience of working with the Low/No code platform and the application used is Betty Blocks. 

As a part of the extra-curriculum activity, I was engaged as a project member of "Diversity in European Volunteering" project which was hosted by "Young European Federalists".

Please feel free to contact me on +31 618 8452 37 or email me at diptosaha4@gmail.com, for any kind of queries. 

Thank you so much for your valuable time!

awards.title: Mobility Summer School 2017- (First) 1st Place Price
awards.description:
This year in 2017, I participated in IDEA League, Mobility Summer School, 2017 in RWTH Aachen University from Chalmers University of Technology. We were five people in total who got selected from Chalmers and in total twenty four people from other six universities where two universities were an addition in this IDEA League this time. 
We were divided into five people for doing one project for this summer school and at the end we presented our project. 
At the end, our group got the first prize on the basis of our presented project in this competition , more specifically ,  mobility of summer school 2017.

projects.title: Mobility of Youth Workers
projects.description: The first phase of the project was hosted by Young European Federalists and implemented in cooperation with Erasmus Student Network International, Erasmus Student Network Sweden, Erasmus Student Network Dubrovnik, AEGEE-Europe, AEGEE-Athens, AEGEE-Cagliari, JEF Europe, JEF France, JEF Bulgaria. The participation was supported by ESN Göteborg.

projects.title: Case Study Project with Rottne Industri AB - Value stream mapping
projects.description: The project was to improve the production flow with reduced WIP by the help of Value Stream Mapping method. Initially, the current state of the production system was analysed and recommendation was provided for the future state to overcome the problems. The VSM (Value Stream Mapping) tool was used to map the current state of the system and to explore the improvement opportunities. However, in this case the CF (Cabin Foundation) of the forwarder product family was analysed.

projects.title: Pinyata – a coupon/e-coupon based company
projects.description: Increasing the traffic for the application of Pinyata (Marketing) via market research.

projects.title: Doctor STD – a platform for getting advice, medical information & to share the experiences  of STD
projects.description:  Increasing the sign up (user) for this startup company   Increasing the traffic for the application of doctor STD (Marketing)

projects.title: Six Sigma Black Belt Project
projects.description:
	The project aims to improve parts of the Design Verification Process within SCA as well as educate the involved project members to become Black Belts. A control plan was formulated that discusses how SCA should act when implementing the improvements. 
	The suggested process improvements consist of improvements on how the assessment of Design Input and Design Output should be planned and executed with emphasis on formulating clear acceptance criteria.

projects.title: An in-depth study of the operations strategy of SCA
projects.description: The operational processes and strategies of SCA was analyzed and evaluated, using the STRATEGO. The STRATEGO was designed to analyze the manufacturing strategy and how it related to the organization’s competitive priorities. However, this project only focused on the brand Edet and their position in the Swedish market.

projects.title: Improvement of Product Quality, Faster Food AB
projects.description: Improvement of the quality of chicken nuggets with fries produced by a pseudo-organization in the frozen food industry, Faster Food AB through customer and competitor analyses, facilitated by the combined use of Kano Surveys and Quality Function Deployment (QFD).

projects.title: Implementation of Lean Manufacturing Tools and Techniques in RMG sector of Bangladesh- Bachelor Thesis
projects.description:
	The project aims to investigate how lean manufacturing tools can be adapted & implemented.
	Suggested process provides pragmatic guidelines for the garments manufacturers to implement lean manufacturing tools and technique to improve their industrial productivity and capacity by applying some essential tools.

profile_positions.title: Prime Performance Engineer

profile_positions.description: The thesis is done at "SKF Group" on the topic titled "Supply Chain Transparency for SKF Group Purchasing". The main aim of this thesis project is to define supply chain transparency and its requirements in SKF Purchasing perspective. Besides, at the same time matching standards of Global manufacturers and developing road map about its implementation including technological evolution in purchasing for increasing transparency. The thesis also aims at identifying benefits and challenges of complete transparency with the consideration of the risk management. In short, the thesis talks about ‘why’, ‘where’ and ‘how’- the transparency is required in the supply chain of SKF Group Purchasing.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Student

Black Dot is a non-profit organization that strives to lower the threshold for students to pursue social impact through innovation and entrepreneurship. 
Responsible for student recruitment during innovation drives conducted by Black Dot and for hiring volunteers to be employed under the organization.

Erasmus Student Network (ESN) is the biggest student association in Europe. It was born on the 16th October 1989 and legally registered in 1990 for supporting and developing student exchange. It presents more than 900 Higher Education Institutions from 40 countries. It is co funded by the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union. The network is constantly developing and expanding. ESN Sweden is a part of the ESN International, and consist of a national board and different local sections.

At the moment ESN Sweden has 14 different sections: Borås, BTH, Göteborg, Jönköping, Kalmar, Linköping, Luleå, Lund, Malmö, Skövde, Stockholm University, Södertorn,Växjö and Örebro, whose goal is to work for international students who spend parts or all of their university studies in another country than their country of origin. It works actively with projects that will improve the situation for international students studying in Sweden. Those projects are based on three levels: local, national and international. ESN Göteborg is organizing events on both national and local level.

Additionally, was an active member of Swedish Finance Committee (SFICO) in ESN Sweden. This committee was formed in last autumn (2017) and I was part of it till the end of May'18. It is still working in different projects to support the treasurer and the partnership manager of ESN Sweden and to provide advice and assistance to the local sections and local treasurers and partnership managers of the Swedish network.

CIRC is a board of 9-10 elected members of the Chalmers Student Union. CIRC's primary goal is to ensure smooth and painless transition of international students from their home countries to Chalmers, Göteborg and Sweden. CIRC remains in office for one year during which the members conceptualize, conceive, plan and implement various ideas that could make the life of international students easier in an environment quite alien to them. Furthermore, the responsibilities of ESN Event Manager is organizing the ESN events at Chalmers, such as the transportation to the Sea Battle or planning other events such as Social Erasmus, Exchange ability or Responsible Party.

SNI is a student body of Industrial Economics department at Chalmers University of Technology. It supports students to solve challenges with their curriculum and also create a bridge between students and teachers of the department.

Chalmers organizes "calling project" every year for International students. I was one of the participants of the Calling Project for Autumn-2017 session. The main goal of the calling project is to provide information to the International students about academic issues, food, culture, accommodation and so on.
At CSS, we promote sustainability among students at Chalmers and Gothenburg by organizing events for raising awareness.

Chalmers Börssällskap is the largest association with its over 1,000 annual members Chalmers. The purpose of the association is to spread knowledge about, and promote interest in, economics and entrepreneurship. This is mainly through lunch lectures held by interesting and well-known people from industry, industry and finance. So, as a member I attended quite a few lunch lectures.

Worked in the CHARM'17 at Chalmers University of Technology. The work was more or less regarding the marketing stuffs arrangement during the fair for the people attended in the fair both from company side and from student side.
Organized the Christmas Party'16 of our I-Sektionen of Chalmers. I was one of the main organizer of this Christmas Party.

ESTIEM is a non-profit, non-political organization for European Students of Industrial Engineering and Management, who combine technological understanding with management skills. I was one of the member of this organization.
ESTIEM is a strong network represented by 81 Local Groups across Europe, reaching more than 60 000 students. All these independently-functioning local student associations organize Europe-wide and local activities, and represent ESTIEM in their universities.
